title: Implement Compatibility-mode write-set spill + coordinator-only WAL append
close_reason: Obsolete: planning-phase spec updated; implementation work will be re-triaged later

title: Spec Evolution Viz: Next UX/Feature Pass
description: Follow-up work to make the spec-evolution visualization more powerful, intuitive, and shareable (desktop + mobile), while keeping everything static-site deployable (Cloudflare Pages) and offline-friendly.

title: Viz: Compare Two Arbitrary Commits (A/B)
description: Add a compare mode where users pick two commits (A and B) and see a rendered diff between reconstructed spec snapshots (Diff2Html), plus metrics (lines/tokens/lev). Should support keyboard + mobile-friendly selection.

title: Viz: Outlier Dashboard (Largest Deltas + Chart Annotations)
description:
Goal
- Make the most important moments obvious: a dashboard that surfaces commits (or time bins) with the largest changes (Δlines/Δtokens/Δlev, bucket-weighted), and annotates those points directly on the charts.

UX (Desktop)
- Outlier panel: Top-N list with metric selector and filters (bucket, time resolution, day/hour/15m/5m).
- Clicking an outlier jumps timeline + opens doc/diff at that commit; chart point pulses subtly.

UX (Mobile)
- Compact list inside sheet; tap-to-jump with a back affordance.

Implementation Notes
- Outlier scoring should be explainable and robust (median/MAD z-score preferred over mean/stddev).
- Support both per-commit and aggregated-bin outliers (wall-clock bins).
- Persist selection in URL state for sharing.

Acceptance Criteria
- Users can find "big changes" in under 5 seconds and jump to them reliably.

Testing
- Unit tests for robust outlier scoring + tie-breaking.
- E2E: select metric, open outlier, verify commit idx/hash + chart marker.

title: Outliers: Compute Robust Scores (MAD Z) + Top-K
description:
Implement explainable outlier detection:
- For each metric series (lines/tokens/lev and bucket-weighted variants), compute robust center/scale (median + MAD).
- Compute robust z-scores; rank top-K with stable tie-breaking (timestamp then hash).
- Support both per-commit series and aggregated time-bin series.
- Export an "evidence" object per outlier: value, median, MAD, z, and contributing buckets.

title: Outliers: UI Panel + Chart Point Annotations
description:
Build the outlier UX:
- Panel: metric dropdown, Top-N selector, filters (buckets, time resolution), and a clear "why this is an outlier" evidence drawer.
- Charts: annotate outlier points (small markers) + hover tooltip; clicking marker selects corresponding list item and jumps commit.
- Mobile: panel inside sheet; chart annotation remains visible but not cluttered.

title: Outliers: Unit Tests (Robust Scoring + Evidence)
description:
Unit tests:
- MAD z-score correctness on synthetic series with known median/MAD.
- Edge cases: MAD=0, short series, NaNs, identical points.
- Evidence object: ensure it includes value/median/MAD/z and sums for bucket-weighted series.

Diagnostics
- On failure, print the series, computed stats, and top-K list.

title: Outliers: E2E Tests (Panel + Chart Marker Jump)
description:
E2E scenarios:
- Select metric (lev), set Top-N=5, click #1 outlier -> commit selection changes and charts show marker.
- Click marker on chart -> outlier list selection changes and doc/diff updates.

Diagnostics
- Log chosen metric, outlier ids/hashes, and whether chart marker series is present.

title: Viz: Heading Mini-Map + Changed-Section Highlighting
description: Add a left-side (desktop) / slide-over (mobile) heading mini-map generated from the rendered markdown, with per-commit indicators for which headings changed. Clicking a heading scrolls the doc pane; diff view can auto-scroll to first change under that heading.

title: Viz: Shareable Permalinks (URL State) + Copy Link
description: Encode visualization state in the URL (commit idx, tab, resolution, metric, bucket filters). Add a Copy Link button. Deep links should load without needing any server logic.

title: Viz: Story Mode (Curated Milestones + Autoplay)
description: Add an optional narrative layer: curated milestones (hand-picked commits) with short annotations and an autoplay scrubber. Desktop: right-side timeline card; Mobile: full-screen swipeable cards.

title: Viz: Performance Pass (Worker Metrics + Caching)
description: Move heavy work (patch application for far jumps, Levenshtein precompute) into a WebWorker; cache reconstructed snapshots/metrics in-memory + localStorage keyed by dataset hash. Keep initial load fast.

title: Viz: Dataset Tooling (Regen + Validate)
description: Add a small, safe regeneration + validation tool for spec_evolution_data_v1.json.gz (append new commits, assert patches apply cleanly, assert commit counts match git). Prefer a one-shot CLI (Rust or Python) with zero repo-wide rewrites.

title: Viz: Playback Mode (Play/Pause + Speed Control + Loop)
description:
Goal
- Add a true playback mode that automatically advances commits like a video scrubber (play/pause/step), with speed control and optional loop. This should feel extremely smooth on mobile and enable passive exploration.

UX (Desktop)
- Play/pause, step back/forward, speed (0.25x..8x), loop toggle in the bottom dock.
- While playing, charts and doc panes stay responsive; no layout jank.

UX (Mobile)
- Thumb-zone controls: big play/pause + step; speed via compact sheet slider; haptics optional (if available).
- Autopause on heavy interactions (manual scrub, text selection, opening panels).

Implementation Notes
- Deterministic state machine (playing/paused/seeking) with requestAnimationFrame or setInterval + drift correction; use document visibility API to pause in background.
- Respect prefers-reduced-motion: default to paused and lower update rate.
- Persist playback state via URL state (depends on permalinks).

Acceptance Criteria
- Can play from any commit; index advances monotonically at chosen rate; pause freezes index exactly.
- Manual scrub interrupts playback safely and predictably.
- No console errors; no noticeable lag on mid-range mobile.

Testing
- Unit tests for scheduler drift correction + state transitions.
- E2E (Playwright) for desktop + mobile: start play, observe commit index change, pause, scrub, resume; capture console + timing logs.

title: Playback: Core Scheduler + State Machine
description:
Implement a deterministic playback controller:
- State machine: paused | playing | seeking (manual scrub) with clear transitions.
- Drift correction (don't accumulate setInterval drift); clamp index at ends; loop option.
- Document visibility: pause when hidden; resume optionally.
- Hooks: onTick(commitIndex) -> render; onManualScrub -> cancel playback safely.

Deliverables
- Small, testable pure functions for time->commit index mapping and transition logic (used by unit tests).

title: Playback: Dock UI + Mobile Controls
description:
Wire playback controls into the UI:
- Bottom dock: play/pause, step, speed slider, loop toggle, and a "playing" indicator that doesn't feel noisy.
- Mobile: larger tap targets + optional speed control inside the existing bottom sheet.
- A11y: keyboard shortcuts for play/pause and step; ARIA labels; respects prefers-reduced-motion (no autoplay).
- Interaction rules: any manual scrub immediately pauses; changing tab (diff/doc/metrics) should not break playback.

title: Playback: Unit Tests (Scheduler + State Transitions)
description:
Add comprehensive unit tests with detailed logging for the playback controller.

Scope
- State transition table coverage (paused<->playing<->seeking).
- Drift correction: simulate wall-clock drift and assert expected index sequence.
- Loop/clamp behavior at bounds.
- Reduced-motion behavior: default paused; no autoplay.

Constraints
- Prefer Node built-in test runner (node:test) or the lightest possible harness (avoid adding a package manager).
- Tests should log scenario name, seed (if any), timing parameters, and resulting index sequence for fast debugging.

title: Playback: E2E Tests (Playwright Desktop + Mobile)
description:
Add E2E coverage for playback in a real browser (Playwright) with strong diagnostics.

Scenarios
- Desktop viewport: open page, wait for dataset load, press play, assert commit index advances; pause; step; scrub; resume.
- Mobile viewport: same scenarios; verify tap targets; ensure dock/sheet controls remain usable.

Logging
- Capture console logs + page errors; emit structured step logs with timestamps and current commit hash/idx.
- On failure: screenshot + HTML dump + console tail.

Acceptance Criteria
- Tests pass reliably (no flaky timing). Use explicit waits tied to UI state (not arbitrary sleeps).

title: Viz: Section-Level Diff Summary (Per-Heading Metrics)
description:
Goal
- Provide a section-level summary of what changed for the current commit (and for A/B compares): per-heading counts for lines/tokens/lev + dominant buckets, so users can jump directly to the interesting parts.

UX (Desktop)
- New panel: a sortable table (Heading | Δlines | Δtokens | Δlev | top buckets) + tiny sparklines.
- Clicking a row scrolls the doc pane; optional "focus mode" that temporarily collapses other UI to keep attention on the section.

UX (Mobile)
- Sheet-first: compact list with clear Δ badges; tapping jumps + highlights that section briefly.

Implementation Notes
- Parse rendered markdown headings into a stable outline (id anchors).
- Map diff hunks to headings by nearest preceding heading boundary in the *rendered* doc.
- Cache per-commit section summaries; compute incrementally to avoid O(N^2).

Acceptance Criteria
- For any commit, user can see a list of headings with meaningful "what changed" numbers and jump accurately.
- Sorting and filtering are fast.

Testing
- Unit tests for heading extraction and hunk->heading mapping (synthetic docs/diffs).
- E2E tests: click top changed section -> scrolls and highlights; works on mobile.

title: Section Summary: Heading Outline Extraction + Stable Anchors
description:
Implement a robust heading outline extractor:
- Source of truth: rendered markdown headings (not raw markdown) so IDs match scroll targets.
- Generate stable anchor IDs and store (heading text, level, element id, offsetTop) for the current snapshot.
- Handle duplicate headings (disambiguate IDs deterministically).
- Expose a query API: getOutline(commitIdx) -> outline[] used by mini-map + section summary.

title: Section Summary: Attribute Diff Hunks to Headings + Metrics
description:
Compute per-heading change metrics for each commit:
- Parse unified diff hunks; attribute each added/removed line to the nearest preceding heading boundary in the rendered snapshot.
- Metrics per heading: Δlines (add/del), Δtokens (approx), Δlev (from WASM), and bucket contributions (if classification exists).
- Caching: memoize per-commit summaries keyed by dataset hash + commit idx + resolution.
- Performance: incremental compute; avoid rebuilding entire outline each time.

title: Section Summary: UI Panel + Jump/Highlight Interactions
description:
Build the UX for section-level summaries:
- Desktop: sortable table + filters + tiny sparklines; click row scrolls doc to heading and briefly highlights it (non-jarring animation).
- Mobile: bottom-sheet list with large tap targets and a "back to list" affordance.
- Integrate with existing heading mini-map: shared outline + consistent highlighting.
- Ensure interaction works in both single-commit view and A/B compare mode.

title: Section Summary: Unit Tests (Outline + Hunk Attribution)
description:
Unit tests with strong diagnostics:
- Heading extraction: duplicates, weird punctuation, deep nesting, empty headings.
- Hunk attribution: synthetic docs + diffs; assert correct section attribution and metric sums.
- Performance sanity: ensure attribution is near-linear in diff size for typical cases.

Logging
- Each test logs input outline + diff summary and the resulting per-section metrics on failure.

title: Section Summary: E2E Tests (Jump to Section + Mobile Sheet)
description:
E2E coverage:
- Desktop: open section summary, sort by Δlev, click top row -> doc scrolls to correct heading; highlight appears then fades.
- Mobile: open sheet, tap section -> jumps; back to list works; no dock overlap.

Diagnostics
- Log selected heading id/text, scrollTop before/after, and whether highlight element is present.

title: Viz: Search Across History (First-Introduced + Most-Edited)
description:
Goal
- Add a powerful search experience across the entire spec evolution: find text/sections across commits, answer "when was this introduced?", and identify the most-edited sections over time.

UX (Desktop)
- Global search (Cmd/Ctrl+K): type query, see ranked results grouped by (Commit) and (Section).
- Quick actions: jump to commit, open diff, pin as a "reference".

UX (Mobile)
- Search button in header; full-screen search sheet with large results and 1-tap jump.

Implementation Notes
- Build an offline-friendly index (no GitHub API): tokenization + inverted index over (commit subject, diff patch text, headings).
- Compute/refresh in a worker; persist in localStorage keyed by dataset hash.
- Provide query modes: exact phrase, token contains, and "first-introduced" (earliest commit where token appears in added lines).

Acceptance Criteria
- Query latency feels instant after index build; initial build shows progress and can be canceled.
- Jump from a search result lands at the right commit + section and highlights the match.

Testing
- Unit tests for tokenization/index correctness (including tricky punctuation).
- E2E tests: search on desktop/mobile, jump to result, verify highlight and correct commit selection.

title: History Search: Build Inverted Index (Worker + localStorage)
description:
Implement the search index pipeline:
- Tokenize: lowercased words + optional stemming-lite; keep exact phrase mode via raw substring scan.
- Sources: commit subjects, diff patches, headings outline (optional full doc text later).
- Index structures: token -> sorted commitIdx list (delta-compressed in storage); token -> per-commit positions optionally for highlighting.
- Build in WebWorker; provide progress callbacks and cancellation.
- Persist to localStorage keyed by dataset hash; migrate safely if schema changes.

title: History Search: UX (Cmd/Ctrl+K Palette + Mobile Sheet)
description:
Build the actual search experience:
- Desktop: Cmd/Ctrl+K opens palette; supports keyboard navigation; enter jumps; esc closes.
- Mobile: full-screen sheet with search input pinned at top; large results; 1-tap jump.
- Result types:
  - Commits (subject + hash + time + top metrics)
  - Sections/headings (heading path + earliest hit + change magnitude)
- On jump: selects commit, scrolls to section (if available), and highlights match text.

title: History Search: First-Introduced + Most-Edited Analytics
description:
Add the two killer query modes:
- First-introduced: given token/phrase, find earliest commit where it appears in added lines (with surrounding context preview).
- Most-edited: compute a per-heading "edit mass" over time (sum of Δtokens or Δlev) and expose top sections + their peak bursts.

Implementation Notes
- Prefer deterministic, explainable metrics (no opaque ML).
- Cache analytics results; incremental updates when dataset extends.

title: History Search: Unit Tests (Tokenizer + Index + Analytics)
description:
Unit tests (with great logs):
- Tokenizer: unicode-ish punctuation, code blocks, dashes, underscores; ensure stable tokenization.
- Index: token -> commit list correctness; delta-compression round-trip; cancellation/resume.
- First-introduced: synthetic diff series where token appears/disappears; ensure earliest add is returned.
- Most-edited: synthetic per-heading sequences; ensure correct ranking and tie-breaking.

Diagnostics
- Print failing token, expected/actual commit lists, and minimal repro diff.

title: History Search: E2E Tests (Query + Jump + Highlight)
description:
E2E scenarios:
- Desktop: open palette, type query, arrow down/up, enter -> commit changes and match is highlighted in doc; back/forward preserves state via permalinks.
- Mobile: open sheet, type query, tap result -> jumps; close sheet and dock still usable.
- Analytics: select "first introduced" result and verify commit is not later than any other hit.

Diagnostics
- Log query, top 5 results (ids), chosen result, and final commit idx/hash.

title: Spec: TxnSlot claiming_timestamp stale during CLEANING takeover
description: In §5.6.2 cleanup_orphaned_slots, a cleaner CASes txn_id -> TXN_ID_CLEANING and then stores claiming_timestamp=now. There is a window where another cleaner can observe txn_id==TXN_ID_CLEANING while claiming_timestamp still contains a stale value from the previous owner (Phase 1 claim time), causing spurious 'stuck CLEANING' takeover. Proposed fix: after Phase 3 publish CAS succeeds (TXN_ID_CLAIMING -> real_txn_id), clear claiming_timestamp to 0 (Release). This makes a future CLEANING transition start from 0, so concurrent cleaners seed a fresh timestamp via CAS(0->now) rather than treating stale timestamps as stuck.
close_reason: Completed in spec: TxnSlot Phase 3 publish clears claiming_timestamp to 0 (Release); cleanup_orphaned_slots seeds claiming_timestamp via CAS(0->now) for CLAIMING/CLEANING so stale timestamps cannot trigger spurious stuck-CLEANING takeover.
